meanings.definition: People who believe that trivial matters are important.
meanings.sent1: The trivialists in the class argued about the color of the pencils.
meanings.sent2: The group of trivialists spent hours discussing the font size on the presentation slides.
meanings.sent3: The trivialists made a big fuss over the shape of the paper clips.
meanings.sent4: She was such a trivialist, always getting caught up in the smallest details.
meanings.sent5: The trivialists were like detectives, searching for significance in the tiniest clues.

meanings.definition: Those who focus on insignificant details.
meanings.sent1: The trivialists noticed the tiniest scratch on the new furniture.
meanings.sent2: Being a trivialist, she couldn't help but point out the misspelled word on the sign.
meanings.sent3: The trivialists giggled at the crooked painting on the wall.
meanings.sent4: He was such a trivialist that he could spot a speck of dust from across the room.
meanings.sent5: The trivialists were like magnifying glasses, zooming in on the smallest imperfections.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who prioritize unimportant things.
meanings.sent1: The trivialists decided to have a meeting to discuss the best way to fold napkins.
meanings.sent2: At the party, the trivialists debated the ideal temperature for serving drinks.
meanings.sent3: The trivialists planned a whole event around choosing the perfect playlist.
meanings.sent4: She joined the trivialists in their quest to find the best brand of sticky notes.
meanings.sent5: The trivialists were like treasure hunters, seeking out the most insignificant treasures.
